attributes.action: Listen to Families Fighting for Special Kids and do something about our complaints.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This petition is for parents/carers of disabled children we are sick and tired of our kids being treated like second class citizens. We hate the fact that we have to fight and complain to try to get things our kids rightfully deserve. 

We intend to make the politicians sit up and take notice without excuses. Parents of disabled kids are voters too ! 

We are fed up with having to pay out more for specialist things like car seats, bathing systems, bikes, special buggies etc, why are these items up to 10 times the cost of "normal" items ?

Why is there no play equipment in public parks or soft play areas that cater to disabled kids, aren't our kids good enough to socialise with their peers ?

Why can't parents and siblings be offered support especially in the early days of diagnosis ? Why can't parents be offered First aid with resus courses, Makaton or baby signing courses.

We are fed up with the discrimination, we want to go into a toyshop and buy a £5 puzzle that won't fall apart when our kids use it, why should we have to pay out £15 for one in a special needs catalogue ?

THIS IS WRONG !

Our kids deserve to be treated equally and at the moment this isn't happening

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
